title: Requires the disclosure of peanut ingredients by restaurants and catering facilities
summary: Requires restaurants and catering facilities to disclose on their menus whether peanuts or peanut derived ingredients are contained in any food served on the premises of such restaurant or catering facility; imposes civil penalties for violations of such provisions.

       Introduced  by M. of A. SPANO, CLARK, BENEDETTO, ZEBROWSKI, STEVENSON --

       AN  ACT  to amend the general business law, in relation to disclosure of
         the peanut ingredients of foods offered at  restaurants  and  catering
         facilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The general business law is amended by adding a new article
    2  12-A to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE 12-A
    4                     RESTAURANTS AND CATERING FACILITIES
    5  SECTION 210. DISCLOSURE OF PEANUT INGREDIENTS BY RESTAURANTS AND  CATER-
    6                 ING FACILITIES.
    7    S  210.  DISCLOSURE  OF PEANUT INGREDIENTS BY RESTAURANTS AND CATERING
    8  FACILITIES. 1. AS USED  IN  THIS  ARTICLE,  "RESTAURANT"  AND  "CATERING
    9  FACILITY"  SHALL  MEAN ANY OUTLET OF A RESTAURANT THAT DERIVES ITS BUSI-
   10  NESS FROM THE SALE OF PREPARED FOOD TO BE CONSUMED BY  PATRONS  OF  SUCH
   11  ESTABLISHMENT ON ITS RESTAURANT OR BANQUET FACILITY PREMISES.
   12    2.  EVERY  RESTAURANT AND CATERING FACILITY SHALL PROVIDE AND DISCLOSE
   13  ON ITS MENU TO EACH PATRON, WHETHER PEANUTS OR ANY PEANUT DERIVED INGRE-
   14  DIENTS ARE CONTAINED IN ANY FOOD PREPARED BY SUCH RESTAURANT OR CATERING
   15  FACILITY, OR PREPARED BY A COMPANY OR INDIVIDUAL CONTRACTED  TO  PROVIDE
   16  FOOD  TO SUCH RESTAURANT OR FACILITY OFF PREMISES WHICH WILL BE CONSUMED
   17  BY THE PATRON FOR ON PREMISES CONSUMPTION.
   18    3. SUCH INGREDIENTS LISTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDI-
   19  VISION TWO OF THIS  SECTION  SHALL  INCLUDE  THE  SPECIFIC  INGREDIENTS,
   20  INCLUDING  PEANUT  AND/OR PEANUT OIL INGREDIENTS, USED IN PREPARATION OF
   21  ANY FOOD.
   22    4. A VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE  PUNISHABLE
   23  BY  A CIVIL PENALTY NOT TO EXCEED FIFTY DOLLARS FOR THE FIRST VIOLATION,

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

       A. 3482                             2

    1  NOT LESS THAN FIFTY DOLLARS AND NOT MORE THAN TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR  A

    3  THAN FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR A THIRD OR SUBSEQUENT VIOLATION  WITHIN  A
    4  TWENTY-FOUR MONTH PERIOD.
    5    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
    6  it shall have become a law.
